page.title: 14Religious Life Grove/D.Worth
page.content: Denchworth C.of E. Church can seat about 100 people and about 16 people attend. There are only occasional services and functions. The parish is tended by a minister from Steventon, who also visits the elderly and sick. Children attend Sunday School once a month. There is no choir. Weddings, christenings and funerals are rare. In Grove the C.of E. is very active. It is regularly packed to capacity (150 people) and there are 4 - 5 services a week besides being prayer and Bible study meetings. The congregation is young, so that thereare activities for families, teenagers and children but there is not yet need to cater for the elderly. Help for the Third World and charities plays a large part in the Church life. A Harvest Supper and Carol Service are popular. Methodists have a Grove Chapel, others fo to W/T.
